message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about evaluating machine reading comprehension (MRC) systems, which falls under the natural language processing (NLP) domain of computer science. The paper specifically focuses on adapting evaluation metrics for MRC systems, which is a common topic in the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper involves statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, which are also relevant to the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Information retrieval (cs.IR) is another relevant sub-category, as MRC systems are often used for information retrieval tasks. Finally, neural networks (cs.NE) may also be relevant, as deep learning models are commonly used for MRC systems.
